creator: kmsluder@optonline.net
text:
In httpd-2.0.50, the htpasswd utility does not work.  Running the command
"htpasswd -c .htpasswd username" causes htpasswd to error out with "htpasswd:
could not determine temp dir" right after asking for the password for the second
time.

Note: I'm using the Fedora Core 1 httpd-2.0.50 RPM.

creator: kess@kess-net.de
text:
Hm, it works for me.
Are you able to reproduce the problem with a htpasswd build from source?
If not, please report this to the Fedora team.

This is fixed if you have the latest FC1 apr package; "rpm -q apr" should give
"apr-0.9.4-2.1", run "up2date apr" otherwise.  (For future reference, it's best
to  report bugs in Fedora Core packages to https://bugzilla.redhat.com/bugzilla/)
creator: jorton@redhat.com
